```{r}
library(ggplot2)
# Define your data
categories <- c("DCIS_1", "DCIS_2", "Prolif_Inv", "Invasiv")
dcis_1_count <- length(list.files("Image_Data/50/DCIS_1/DCIS_1"))
dcis_2_count <- length(list.files("Image_Data/50/DCIS_2/DCIS_2"))
prolif_count <- length(list.files("Image_Data/50/Invasive_Tumor/Invasive_Tumor"))
invasiv_count <- length(list.files("Image_Data/50/Prolif_Invasive_Tumor/Prolif_Invasive_Tumor"))
values <- c(dcis_1_count, dcis_2_count, prolif_count, invasiv_count)

# Create a data frame
df <- data.frame(Category = categories, Value = values)

# Load ggplot2 for advanced plotting


# Create the bar plot
ggplot(df, aes(x = Category, y = Value, fill = Category)) +
  geom_bar(stat = "identity", width = 0.7) +
  scale_fill_brewer(palette = "Set2") +
  labs(
    title = "Figure 2. Number of Images per Cell Type",
    x = "Cell Type",
    y = "Number of Images"
  ) +
  theme_minimal(base_size = 14) +
  theme(
    legend.position = "none",
    plot.title = element_text(hjust = 0.5, face = "bold")
  )
```
